name: Original Mineral Veil Talc-Free Loose Setting Powder SPF 25
about: What it is:.A weightless mineral setting powder that extends makeup wear while bluring and minimizing the appearance of fine lines and pores with no flashback...What it does:.In a range of shades and finishes, Mineral Veil¬Æ Setting Powder is our cult favorite setting powder, versatile enough for all skintones and skin types. The light-as-a-feather, super smooth formulas blend onto skin without smudging the makeup you‚Äôre already wearing. Sheer and never cakey, Mineral Veil¬Æ Setting Powder weightlessly blurs and minimizes the appearance of fine lines and pores, whether it is applied over makeup or onto beautifully bare skin...What it is formulated WITHOUT:.- Parabens.- Sulfates.- Phthalates..What else you need to know:.Original Mineral Veil¬Æ Finishing Powder gives skin a translucent, soft finish. Make the most of your makeup with Mineral Veil, a see-through but spectacular finale for any kind of complexion. It minimizes the look of fine lines, absorbing oils, and softens your complexion for an airbrushed finish...Tinted Mineral Veil Finishing Powder delivers a warm tint finish. All the soft translucence of the original Mineral Veil finishing powder with a touch of warm tint. The finishing powder infuses your skin with softness and light while gently absorbing oil and minimizing the appearance of lines and pores. It goes on completely sheer and is versatile enough for all skintones...Illuminating Mineral Veil Finishing Powder gives your skin a blurring, brightening finish. Completely sheer and versatile enough for all skintones, this complexion illuminator provides a soft glow and keeps skin looking photo-ready. Light-reflecting pearls impart a radiant, ethereal softness...Hydrating Mineral Veil Finishing Powder leaves a cooling, brightening finish. This hydrating finishing powder brightens skin with a sheer, peachy-soft luminosity. The unique water and rice lipid encapsulated formula delivers an immediate brightening boost with a cool feeling. Clinically proven to improve skin‚Äôs ability to retain moisture, it also minimizes the appearance of fine lines, pores, and shine, and keeps your complexion looking fresh.*..This product is formulated without talc...*Based on an independent clinical study....
ingredients: Zea Mays (Corn Starch), Corn Starch Modified, Zinc Stearate, Magnesium Stearate. May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499)......The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:..Swirl, Tap, Buff¬Æ application:..Swirl a small amount of Mineral Veil¬Æ Setting Powder in the lid until it all disappears into the brush...-Tap away excess...-Buff onto the skin in a circular motion...-Apply a quick sweep across the t-zone, around the cheeks or all over the face‚Äîwherever you need Mineral Veil¬Æ to gently lock makeup in place, absorb excess oil, and help keep you looking fresh.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I recently had the pleasure of trying out the BareMinerals Mineral Veil, and let me tell you, it has completely transformed my makeup routine. As someone who is always on the lookout for a finishing powder that provides a flawless, airbrushed finish without feeling heavy or caked-on, this product exceeded my expectations in every way.  First and foremost, the texture of the Mineral Veil is incredible. It's incredibly lightweight and finely milled, which makes it effortless to apply. I love how it effortlessly glides onto my skin, leaving behind a silky-smooth finish. It doesn't accentuate any dry patches or settle into fine lines, which is a huge plus for those with mature or dry skin.  The finish it delivers is simply stunning. The Mineral Veil has a soft-focus effect that blurs imperfections and diffuses light, giving my complexion a radiant and airbrushed appearance. It truly lives up to its name as a veil for the skin, adding a touch of sheer coverage without altering the color or finish of my foundation.  Another standout feature is the impressive staying power of this powder. It helps to control shine and keeps my makeup looking fresh throughout the day. Even in hot and humid weather, I've noticed that my foundation stays in place, and I require fewer touch-ups. It's a game-changer for anyone struggling with oily skin or makeup that tends to fade quickly.  What sets the BareMinerals Mineral Veil apart from other finishing powders on the market is its formulation. It's made with minerals and skin-loving ingredients, which not only contribute to its lightweight feel but also offer skincare benefits. I appreciate that it is free from harsh chemicals, talc, and parabens, making it suitable for sensitive skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm so disappointed to say that I have very much dislike this powder. It's almost like a highlighter it's so shimmery. There's no blurring effect, I'm not sure how the other formulas blur, but this one for me emphasizes and exaggerates. There are little shimmer particles you can actually see on the face. It's just so shimmery. From far away or looks really great, but up close you can see every shimmer particle.  I will still find a purpose for it, but it'll just be in high points of the face (where highlighter will go). Definitely not for the undereyes!  I do have to say that I love the component it's in. I like that it twists closed, though if you get too much product out, it kind of just sits there awkwardly. So it can be a bit messy, but most powders are. I just don't love this, I sourish really recommend it unless you're into the look of shimmer all over the face.

They assured me the formula has not changed and that the product is as described, and that I'd receive a true sheer powder. So I ordered the Hydrating Mineral Veil, and was SHOCKED at what I received. This product is anything but sheer...it's a DEEP TAN/ORANGE COLOR. I tested the product on my face to be sure, and it looks absolutely ridiculous. I again messaged BM (and included a photo) and received some lame, canned response in return. I'm not sure what's going on with this product...but something is definitely not right. If you read the reviews, this issue has been a regular complaint from people since December. I still used all the product and it worked decent. Just some people noticed I had little flakes of glitter or sparkles on my face.

reviews.review_title: WARNING - DO NOT BUY - color has changed to ORANGE
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The color for original has changed.  Is now orange. = (  (I compared an old container to the new one---and it is a drastically different color.)  Whether or not the color change is an accident or intentional is unclear...but either way, customers aren't liking the change.  Have seen similar customer reviews on Sephora, Amazon and Bareminerals.com, etc.  I phoned both Sephora and Bare Minerals.   Neither company cared.  Both gave me canned responses and offered to exchange...which makes no sense.  (Unless they pull and replace current inventory, they will just be sending me more orange powder--ugh!)  They have no interest in fixing the issue itself...  Bottom line: this powder is hideous/ unusable.  I recommend buying something else.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'd been looking for a setting powder for a while and chose this over the more popular Laura Mercier one because it doesn't contain talc, but this didn't really meet my expectations. I have super oily skin and when I buff this on in the morning, it gives me a super matte, almost drying finish -- to the point of visible flakes on my cheeks. While I don't mind my face looking a little dry, by mid-day my t-zone is COMPLETELY soaked through with oil. So this product doesn't do much in the way of oil control. As other reviewers have mentioned, it also has a reddish tint to it which can make you look orangey-tan. It'll do the job decently with some re-application throughout the day, but there are probably better options out there, particularly if you're on the oily side.

reviews.review_text: I love the finish this gives me. Completely controls my oily t-zone all day which no product has ever done for me before, but I‚Äôm heartbroken that it is completely orange. Please make this truly sheer, it‚Äôs a holy grail of a product for me
